description.narrative: Rikweda Fruit Process Company (Rikweda, the Project or the Company) is a 15,000 ton per annum (tpa) raisin processing plant in Kabul, Afghanistan. The Project cost is estimated at US$9.0 million of which US$6 million is financed by the Sponsors' equity. IFC has been invited to extend a revolving working capital facility of up to US$2.5 million renewable on an annual basis for five years. IFC will also extend a C Loan of up to US$0.5 million in exchange for advisory services to support Rikwedas growth.

The Project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) providing farmers with sustainable access to markets; (ii) expected employment creation of 60 direct jobs and a number of indirect jobs across the value chain; (iii) building farmers' capacity through advisory services to support extension services and improve farming practices; (iv) promoting women's role through support to female producers; (v) promoting food safety through IFC's technical assistance services; and (vi) support climate smart agriculture through the construction of a modern processing plant designed to reduce heat waste and increase water efficiency savings.
